name: Seam Binding
description:
Premium quality 100% rayon seam binding. Ultra flexible, thin and washable - the bee's knees for hems, binding seams (self explanatory, I know) and myriad other possibilities! Just like the vintage seam binding of yore. Comes in 1/2" widths in a variety of colors. Don't be caught sewing without it!

Preshrink seam binding before use by spritzing with water and pressing with iron set for rayon.

Sold by the 3 yard increments, but cut in one continuous length depending on amount ordered.

Shipping costs:
United States ......$2.00     ($0.15 w/other items)
Canada ...............$4.00   ($0.25 w/other items)
Everywhere else ..$6.00   ($0.35 w/other items)

name: Polka Dot Petersham Ribbon
description:
A high quality 100% nylon petersham ribbon, polka dotted to perfection. I know what you're thinking. 100% nylon? That sounds kind of "low rent." I thought the same thing folks. This stuff is lovely. Feels marvelous against the skin and is akin to its rayon counterpart. Has drape and fluidity but still has structure and strength to hold up under pressure. Perfect for hems, waistbands and waistband stays, zipper plackets, millinery handicraft, belts and much more. Plus its to die for darling. Who wouldn't want to use it?

Imported from Japan.

Sold by the yard increments, but cut in one continuous length depending on amount ordered.

name: Petersham Ribbon - Honey
description:
Beautiful high quality 100% rayon petersham ribbon in honey hue. This corded ribbon provides structure, strength and flexibility to your sewing projects. Perfect for hems, waistbands and waistband stays, zipper plackets, millinery handicraft, belts and much more. Known for its durability and scalloped edging, this luxurious ribbon is the perfect notion for your next dress. 

Imported from Japan.

Please preshrink ribbon before use by spritzing with water and pressing with iron set for rayon. 

Sold by the yard increments, but cut in one continuous length depending on amount ordered.

description:

description:

Perfect for hems, waistbands and waistband stays, zipper plackets, millinery handicraft, belts and much more. Known for its durability and scalloped edging, this luxurious ribbon is the perfect notion for your next dress.

name: Petersham Ribbon - Lollipop
description:
Beautiful high quality 100% rayon petersham ribbon in lollipop pink hue. This corded ribbon provides structure, strength and flexibility to your sewing projects. Perfect for hems, waistbands and waistband stays, zipper plackets, millinery handicraft, belts and much more. Known for its durability and scalloped edging, this luxurious ribbon is the perfect notion for your next dress. 

Imported from Japan.

Please preshrink ribbon before use by spritzing with water and pressing with iron set for rayon.

Sold by the yard increments, but cut in one continuous length depending on amount ordered.

name: Professional Grade Weft Interfacing
description: What's a tailor without his weft? This high quality, professional grade fusible weft interfacing is just the ticket to a tailoring project. Use for a fusible tailoring method or in addition to your traditional hand tailored method. Great for all suiting weight fabrics and fibers. Perfect cut in strips for hemlines. 60" wide. Cream or Charcoal. 80% viscose, 20% polyester. Apply with steam, pressure and heat to desired area. Best if applied with a press cloth. Sold by the yard, but cut in one continuous length depending on amount ordered.

name: Lambswool
description:
A very hard to find interlining option for your winter coat! This delicate, fluffy loosely knitted fabric/interlining will help keep you warm and toasty while also adding comfort. Use in coat sleeves and body without having to sacrifice fabric drape. Quilt lining to lambswool for added luxury!

62" wide. Lambswool and rayon blend.

Sold by the half yard increments, but cut in one continuous length depending on amount ordered.

name: Tailor's Tape
description: 100% cotton tailor's tape for use in fine and soft tailoring. A finer and less bulky alternative to basic cotton twill tape. Helps create a soft roll for a jacket/coat lapel, great for use in waist bands or knits as a stay tape with a myriad other sewing and tailoring uses. Sold by the 3 yard increments, but cut in one continuous length depending on amount ordered. Example: upon ordering 2 units 6 continuous yards will be cut and shipped.

name: 3-Ply Shoulder Pads
description: Tired of the sad selection of shoulder pads at the sewing stores these days? Look no further! These lovely shoulder pads, though simple in nature are just the ticket for easy insertion in jackets and coats. These 3-ply shoulder pads have only 3 layers of cotton batting giving soft shape and structure to your tailoring project. Perfect loft and height for those with broad square shoulders (tired of feeling like a linebacker in your own tailored jackets anyone?) and can easily be combined into more layers for those with narrow and sloping shoulders. Molds perfectly to the contours of your jacket or coat. Can be used in both men's and women's tailoring projects. Shoulder pads sold by the pair in both white and black. Each shoulder pad measures 9" in length and is 4 1/2" across. Can be cut down to size. Layers can be easily pulled apart for more tailoring control and can easily be covered with fabric. Looking for sleeve heads? Despair not, you'll find those here!

name: Sleeve Heads
description: Easy to use, pre-made sleeve heads! Produces nothing but professional results! For the serious tailor! Made from bias cut muslin with an inner layer of cotton batting. Perfect for jackets and coats and both men's and women's tailoring projects. Sleeve heads sold by the pair in black or white. Each sleeve head measures 16" x 2". Can be cut down to size. Looking for shoulder pads? Look no further than here!

name: Horsehair Braid by the yard
description: Horsehair braid to make your circle skirt hemming a dream! 100% polyester premium quality, horsehair braid with a handy dandy thread pulled edge for whipping that hem into a great retro shape. Comes in Soft and Extra Stiff options. Use Soft horsehair braid in light-weight to medium-weight fabrics, such as silks and cottons. Use Extra Stiff horsehair braid in medium-weight to heavy-weight fabrics, such as thick wools. Horsehair braid can also be used in many other capacities including millinery, corsetry, gown and evening wear. Have a ball finding the perfect use for horsehair braid in your sewing projects. 100% polyester. Sold by the yard. Cut in one continuous length depending on amount ordered. Photo credit: A Fashionable Stitch Linda Hop Skirt - a circle skirt made using horsehair braid in the hem.

name: Silk Organza Sheer Press Cloth
description:
100% silk organza press cloth. Never used an organza press cloth? Well, let me convert you! The last press cloth you'll ever need! This little piece of awesomeness protects your fabric from shine, scorching, press marks and water spots. Better yet, you can see through it. That's right, you can actually see what you're pressing. It's magical. 

If you don't know, silk organza can take the beat. Yup. It's a power house sewing tool. Additionally it can withstand high iron temps plus steam. Don't be caught pressing without it!

22" x 30" (55.8 cm x 76.2 cm). Pinked edges.

name: Wash Away Wonder Tape
description: My other favorite fusible web! This Wonder Tape is truly a wonder! This one is a wash away and completely disappears in the first washing. This wonder notion doesn't require heat to bond to your fabric, yet can be easily ripped away if you've placed it in the wrong area. Won't damage fabric in the least. Fusible web has many uses not the least of which is putting in a perfectly centered slot seam zipper. Don't believe me? Check out my FREE Craftsy class for inserting zips of all kinds! OK, ok. Additionally you can use fusible web to temporarily baste anything together. Ditch the hand basting and get with the times. A little fusible web goes a long way. This stuff comes in 1/4" (5mm) widths. 1/4" (5mm) widths. 10 yards of wonderful fusible web.

name: Clover Fusible Web
description: The best thing since sliced bread. Seriously. One of my favorite brands of fusible web tape. You need this stuff. It's a dream. Fusible web has many uses not the least of which is putting in a perfectly centered slot seam zipper. Don't believe me? Check out my FREE Craftsy class for inserting zips of all kinds! OK, ok. Additionally you can use fusible web to temporarily baste anything together. Ditch the hand basting and get with the times. A little fusible web goes a long way. This stuff comes in 1/4" (5mm) and 1/2" (10mm) widths. Pick your poison. 1/4" (5mm) or 1/2" (10mm) widths. 40 feet of wonderful fusible web. Instructions included in package.

name: Glass Head Silk Pins
description: This is the be-all, end-all pin! As the name suggests these pins are produced exclusively for use in silk fabrics, but work for all lightweight to medium weight fabrics. They're thin (0.5 mm in diameter), they don't leave holes in fabrics and they've got a glass head - easy to find in carpet!, easy to handle and heat proof against hot irons. Yeah, you could say these pins are the cat's meoooow! Produced by Clover, these pins come in a re-closable plastic box - no need to use them all at once now! Don't you dare forget to hop on over and grab up a magnetic pin caddy to match your inner diva! 100 count. Topped in red and white glass heads.

name: Clover Wonder Clips
description:
Where pins fear to tread, there's wonder clips. These are pretty hand, if I do say so myself. I'm actually surprised by just how much I use them. These little doodads come in a ten piece pack and work great for holding a variety of projects. My favorite? Holding bias tape in place as I work around a neckline. Or for sewing with leather too. These babies, don't miss a beat.

Imported from Japan.

name: Clover Deluxe Seam Ripper
description:
One of our favorite seam rippers. I tell this to all my sewing students, "There is no shame in unpicking. It's an integral part of the sewing process." So get yourself a nice seam ripper to make the process more enjoyable. I love the handle grip on this one and it stays sharp for an extra long time. It's just the right size too, being neither too big nor too small. Easy to locate and find in your sewing tool stash.

Imported from Japan with a steel seam ripping head and resin handle.

name: Clover Thread Clippers "Kuroha"
description: Are you still clipping your threads with your sewing shears? You need these. This are the handiest little doodads ever! For the money, these little nippers are wonderfully high quality and they last a long, long time. So long. Made with carbon tooled steel blades and a fiber glass reinforced resin handle. Imported from Japan.

name: Gingher 5" Tailor Points
description:
One of our favorite, most used pairs of scissors. These are wonderful for grading seams, a must in any tailoring project. Beautifully crafted from double plated chrome over nickel, these knife edge craft scissors are small enough, yet strong enough for any seam grading need. Cuts through heavy duty materials like leather and multiple seams with ease. Their shape and size make it easy to maneuver difficult areas. These are most definitely, a workroom essential. 

Made in Italy.

name: Gingher 8" Serrated Dressmaking Shears
description:
If you've never had the pleasure, let me introduce you to a shear cutting wonder. Sewer meet the serrated shear, serrated shear meet sewer. These are THE sewing shears to have. Why? Because they grip fabric like a dream. The micro serrated edge allows you to effortlessly cut through slippery fabrics as it grips while it cuts. Its simply magical! Made from double plated chrome over nickel, these will last a lifetime. Don't forget to have all your sewing scissors sharpened every so often. Includes a protective sheath for shears when not in use.

Made in Italy.

name: Clover Magnetic Pin Caddy
description: A pincushion for everyone! Become converted to the magnetic pincushion camp! Do you sew in a room with carpet? Even if you don't, have no fear of dropping a pin in carpet or on the floor again because now you can find said dropped pin with this handy dandy pincushion. This pin caddy contains a powerful magnet, comes in a Diva-ish colors for the diva sewist in you and is designed with a groove for easy pin pickup. Comes with 10 free silk pins (A Fashionable Stitch approved!) and a great little pin caddy cover for use when storing pins up and out of the way. You'll never need to buy another pin cushion again!

name: Dressmaker's Waxed Tracing Papers
description: Looking for smaller versions of our ever popular waxed tracing paper sheets? This four pack contains one 6.5" x 26" sheet of each of our tracing paper colors - white, yellow, red and blue. Our large sheets of waxed tracing paper are great and all, but these are awfully handy when you don't need something quite so big. Great for transferring pattern marks to fabric! Mark darts, tucks, pleats, buttonholes, plackets, embroidery designs and more with ease. Use with pressure and a blunt edge tracing wheel - like the Clover Double Tracing Wheel! - for best results. Marks should generally be on the wrong side of the fabric. If necessary, please test on a scrap fabric for ease in removal with washing.

name: Clover Double Needle Threader
description:
Do you have a hard time threading needles nowdays? I'm getting there. Need to get those eyes checked. In the meantime, you also need to get one of these handy gizmos. These have not one, but two needle threaders on each end. They're nice too. The threaders have caps on each end to protect those little wires from getting stepped on and bent. You can find them a bunch easier than those cheap little tin ones. Sturdy, long lasting construction. Your friend through all needle threading woes. 

Imported from Japan.

name: Pure Beeswax Daisy Round
description: A sweet little daisy beeswax round for hand sewing! A life saver for all types of hand sewing. Essential when making hand worked buttonholes. A must when hand tailoring, basting or well, hand sewing in general. Make's your thread strong and prevents knotting (worth every penny for this part alone). To use, thread your thread through the beeswax (the scalloped petals make this part easy) and lay inside a press cloth (like the silk organza press cloth) and press with a warm iron to evenly distribute the wax through the thread. Thread your needle and away you go! Measures 2 inches across and 5/8" high. Made in Canada. On a farm, by a sweet gal with pigtails, who's named all her pet bees. Just kidding, except for the made in Canada part.

name: Silk Basting Threads
description: 100% fine silk thread from Japan. Strong as nails, luxurious and beautiful. Comes in a pack of three colors: black, yellow and eggshell. 200 meters on each spool. Beautiful for hand stitching. Fine and strong enough to be used in your machine too!

name: Simflex Expanding Sewing Gauge
description: One of the most brilliant sewing tools ever! Achieve perfectly spaced buttonhole placements. Use for shirring, smocking, gather, tuck and pleat lines, patchwork strips, bias strips and more! To use, lay the simflex over your garment or craft and expand it to the desired length for perfectly measured, equal distances and accurate spacing. For a tutorial on accurate buttonhole placement, hop on over to the blog.

name: Fine Fusible Woven Stay Tape
description:
Do you ever long for a stupendous stay tape? This is the stay tape for you! This magical stay tape can be used on narrow or wide hems, on woven fabric or fabric that you do not wish to give or stretch. Simply marvelous for shoulder seams (cue trumpets and heralding angels for knits!) and crotch seams and for the front of a cardigan. Produced by Emma Seabrooke of Sewkeys E.

Comes in 1/2"  & 1 1/4" widths on a 25 yard roll - enough for a lifetime of t-shirt shoulder seams and cardigan button plackets plus gifting some to your best sewing friend!

name: Fine Fusible Knit Stay Tape
description: In addition to the ever so popular straight stay tape, here's a knit stay tape for your curvy seams. This magical stay tape can be use on narrow or wide hems, on woven fabric or knitted fabric that you do not wish to give or stretch. Simply marvelous for curvy necklines (cue trumpets and heralding angels!!) and hems and for side seams and sleeves - great for laces! Produced by Emma Seabrooke of Sewkeys E. Comes in 1/2" & 1 1/4" widths on a 25 yard roll - enough for a lifetime of stay taped seamlines, stabilized zipper openings and gifting some to your best sewing friend!

name: Large Wax Tracing Paper Sheets
description:
Tired of crummy tracing paper that doesn't actually leave any markings for you to work with? We are too! Introducing professional grade wax tracing paper sheets! These babies are BIG! They are amazing! They will last you for a very long time! You will LOVE them!

X-large sheets measure 26" x 39" and come in four standard colors: Red, White, Blue and Yellow. 

Please be aware that these tracing papers will create permanent markings on fabric, paper and any other medium on which you choose to use them. Please also note that to keep shipping costs down, these tracing papers will be carefully folded for packaging.

name: Clover Double Tracing Wheel
description: A sewist's hardest job just made a billion times easier!! Fellow sewists, its time to get with times and get yourself a double tracing wheel. Fear sewing patterns with no seam allowances no longer! Yay! With one of these little ditties the work is already done for you! That's right. Meet your new best friend, the Double Tracing Wheel. Hip! HIp! Hooray! Marks seam lines and cutting lines in one. fell. swoop. Experience the Clover difference. Experience the revolution. Experience a huge sigh of relief. Tracing wheel widths adjust from .4" - 1.2" (10mm - 30mm). That's right, I said adjustable! Need revolutionary tracing paper - hop like a bunny to the professional grade tracing papers.

name: Medical Exam Paper
description: Any sewist knows how hard it is to find a good butcher paper for pattern fitting alterations, rub-offs, patternmaking, etc. This is the paper for all those things. I love this paper! Just like the medical exam paper found in a doctor's office, here's a roll just for you. Perfect weight, perfect for writing on and taping up. Easy to see through and ideal for a menagerie of sewing uses. 21" wide (53.3 cm) x 75 yards (68.5 meters). Comes on a roll. Enough for a lifetime of slashing and spreading. For a quick and dirty tutorial of just how cool this paper is, click here! Enjoy fellow pattern tracers! Shipping costs: United States ......$11.00 ($9.00 w/other items) Canada ...............$13.00 ($10.00 w/other items) Everywhere else ..$25.00 ($21.00 w/other items)

name: Perfect Pleater
description: "This ingenious fabric-tuck device is so simple and easy to use, it's a wonder! Simply tuck your material into the Perfect Pleater and steam and press the pleats in place. Makes inches or yards of continuous 1/4" or larger pleats." -- from the envelope packaging Think of the countless uses for this pleater board - perfectly pleated skirts and trims! Works especially wonderfully for creating many yards knife pleats without the hassle and time investment of doing them all by hand and hand basting. Pleater board is 8 1/2" x 11" with 1/4" pleat louvers and a 3/8" pleat return. Make 1/4" or larger pleats by simply inserting the fabric between the louvers at every bar/bars to create the size pleats desired. Use a ruler, like the clear gridded ruler, to place the fabric in the pleating board at desired intervals. Steam, press and sew pleats in place.

name: Clay Triangle Chalk
description: For the serious tailor! This clay triangle chalk is best for wool fabrics, being easy to see and easy to remove. Note that wax and carbon chalk, the most common kind of chalk, gets hard if not impossible to remove from wool fabrics - ask me how I know!! Pick from popular colors: Blue, White, Red and Yellow. Chalks measure 2 1/4" at widest angles. Each color sold separately. These professional tailors' chalks are sturdy and perfectly proportioned for all types of marking uses - won't crumble and disintegrate right before your eyes! Makes easy to see and clear marks! Use exclusively on wool and wool blended fabrics. Looking for stellar chalk for uses on all other fabrics? Hop over to the amazing chalk pens!

name: Clover Chaco Liner Style Pen
description: Looking for a better marking tool? Look no further! These lovely liner style pens create a fine, easily distinguishable chalk marking. Marks notches, dart lines, dots and circles, etc., with ease. Fits easily in your hand too! Best news of all - these puppies are refillable! Battle crumbly chalk no more (no more falling apart in the grip of serious sewing!) or crummy marking pencils that don't mark and don't play friendly with pencil sharpeners! Your one stop for perfectly perfect markings from now on! Currently stocked in shades of blue, pink, white and yellow with refills to boot! Please note that these chalk pens work best on all fabrics except wool. For special wool clay chalk, hop over here!

name: Collins' Quilt & Sew Ruler
description: The perfect tool for drafting! Don't let the name of this tool fool you - this dressmaker's dream ruler measures 2 inches by 18 inches with 1/8" printed grid and 1/16" markings around outer edge. Perfect for adding seam allowances, creating right angles (wait, did someone say 'grainlines') and to boot, marking centers and drafting circles and scallops with the addition of pierced holes every 1/2 inch. Made of flexible plastic with added instructions for use on the back of the packaging. Now how's that for magical. A lifelong friend, don't be caught drafting without it!

name: Bamboo Point Turner & Presser
description:
A multi-purpose tool used to turn points on wearables and appliques. This point turner & presser is also used for pressing seams when hand, machine or foundation piecing. Use round end to temporarily mark fabric with a crease. Use pointed end to guide fabric when machine stitching. 

Makes turning a collar point or waistband corner a dream! Plus made from bamboo, this tool won't melt when used in conjunction with your iron. A fine addition to any serious sewing enthusiast's tool box.

name: Collapsible Tailoring Board
description:
The ultimate pressing tool for shirt and jacket makers! Fully collapsible with smooth hard surfaces for pressing shoulders, collar points, rounded collars, sleeve heads and more to perfection. 

13.25 inches at widest point and 5.25 inches in height.

Made in the U.S.A. Finished, but untreated hardwood.

Shipping costs:
United States ......$11.00     ($9.00 w/other items)
Canada ...............$15.00   ($13.00 w/other items)
Everywhere else ..$20.00   ($18.00 w/other items)

name: Point Presser & Clapper
description:
A two-in-one Point Presser & Clapper for high quality pressing needs. Makes pressing points in collars a dream! Aids in pressing bulky seams flat while also having the ability to help cool fabric faster to prevent stretch and warp. Essential for use when working with wool.

Use the point presser for pressing narrow and hard to reach areas in collars, cuffs, corners, etc. Use the clapper to press seams open, especially on bulky fabrics such as wool. Also aids in cooling and resisting shine left by irons. 

Measures 11 1/2 inches in length and 3 1/2 inches in height. 

Shipping costs:
United States ......$9.50     ($8.50 w/other items)
Canada ...............$12.00   ($11.00 w/other items)
Everywhere else ..$17.00   ($15.00 w/other items)

name: Wooden Clapper
description:
An essential pressing tool! The clapper works wonders for getting seams nice and flat whilst, due to its wood nature, absorbs heat and moisture to eliminate fabric distortion or stretching. A must when tailoring! Great for all pressing needs. 

To use, press seam or desired area with iron and immediately apply the clapper with pressure. For intersecting bulky seams, pound the seam with the clapper immediately after pressing then apply pressure to remove heat and moisture from fabric. 

Made in the USA. Finished but untreated wood with grooves for easy gripping. Measures 9.5" in length (24.1 cm), 3" wide (7.6 cm) at widest point and 1.75" high (4.4 cm). Weighs approximately 1 lb (.45 kg). 

Shipping costs:
United States ......$8.00     ($5.00 w/other items)
Canada ...............$12.00   ($8.00 w/other items)
Everywhere else ..$20.00   ($17.00 w/other items)

name: Belt Backing
description: Is your sewing project in need of a stellar matching belt? Make your own! Hy-tec propylene belt backing. Use to make your own fabric covered belts, a perfect option for those who want a matching belt for that lately stitched dress. To make your own belt, you will need the measurement of your waist, plus approximately 10 inches. Sold in 1/2 yard increments but cut in one continuous length. Please note that this listing is for the belt backing only. Buckles, prongs, eyelets and adhesive patterns are not included. Looking for more belt making supplies? Click here for the full selection.

name: Dritz Eyelet Tool
description: The best eyelet tool for your sewing money! The Dritz Eyelet Tool allows you to apply any 3/16" diameter eyelets to fabric, belt backing, paper and leather. Best used on a hard surface like cement or a marble slab. Apply with a hammer, rawhide, plastic or wooden mallet. For a detailed look at how to apply an eyelet, jump over here. Please note eyelets and eyelet washers are not included.

name: Eyelet & Washer Sets
description: Need a few eyelets and washers for a belt making project? These are premium nickle plated eyelets and washers perfect for the home sewer. Eyelets are 3/16" in diameter and 6/32" in length and are un-scored making for a beautiful rolled back finish. Washer's are slightly domed and slide over the back of the eyelet before being set, dome side up. Built strong to last long leaving a professional finish to your handmade belt. Sold in sets of 10 (enough for 2 belts) or 25 (enough for 5 belts). Need a few ideas? How about some tips and tricks to make your belt come out great? Take a detour to the blog for some great inspiration plus tricks of the trade to get a belt with professional results! Looking for more belt making supplies? Click here for the full selection.

name: Lucite Belt Buckles
description: Aren't these vintage style lucite buckles fabulous? Talk about perfect for a little beltmaking fun! Made from lucite, these little sliders measure 2.75" wide (7 cm) and 2.25" high (5.7 cm). Middle bar holds 1.25" belt backing (3.2 cm) or ribbon, whichever you fancy! Currently stocked in candy colors Lipstick Red, Peachy Pink, Steel Grey & Aquamarine.
